hours._text:
All welcome to take part in the existing community activities and events taking part, which includes:

Wednesdays, 10am to 1.30pm - Renew Wellbeing Café
Hot drinks, cakes and soup. Craft, jigsaws, board games, quiet space or bring your own hobby.

Once a month on Saturdays 9.30am to 11am - ‘Who Let the Dads Out’
Activities for pre-schoolers, infants and Dads. Drinks and food are available.

First Sunday of month 6pm to 7.30pm - Waste Not Café
Cooking up surplus food donated by supermarkets into a three-course vegetarian and vegan meal.

Contact details:

Rev. Steve Barnwell
07939 103079 / 01246 221105
www.chesterfieldbaptistchurch.org
revstevecbc@gmail.com 

Waste not café: https://dva.org.uk/waste-not-cafe-chesterfield/

Opening Hours:

Monday: 9am - 7pm
Tuesday: 9am - 7pm
Wednesday: 9am - 7pm
Thursday: 9am - 7pm
Friday: 9am - 7pm
Saturday: 9am - 4pm
Sunday: Closed

The library is a warm and welcoming place to go.

It can’t offer the same facilities as a ‘Warm Space’ venue but it is a place people can go to get warm and be signposted to sources of information and support if they need it.

Contact:

Phone: 01629 533 400
Email: chesterfield.library@derbyshire.gov.uk

Fridays, 3pm to 6pm, Cornerstone coffee bar area.

Free drinks and food, with board games, screen available to show family-friendly films and Xbox games.

Contact:

Angela Walker
Call: 01246 273290 / 07850 063910
Email: angela.j.walker26@gmail.com

Church from the Bus

Monday and Thursday 6.45pm to 7.30pm
(times likely to change)

For people who are homeless and in need.

Contact details:

Ian Macleod and Andrew Lamb

Chesterfield Community Church

Tuesdays from 10.30am until 4pm.

Free lunch from 12.30pm, refreshments all day.

Contact details:

Mr Tom Parker, 07769 9535524

properties.title: Church from the Bus / Chesterfield Community Church

hours._text:
Fridays, 1pm to 4pm.

A free warm space, offering light refreshments after school hours.

Contact details:

Jonathan Hood
07707 045510

89 New Square
Chesterfield
S40 1PH

Mondays, 10.30am to 12.30pm – Warm space, tea, coffee, biscuits and a natter.

Wednesdays, 10.30am to 1pm – as above plus wellbeing forum. Arts, crafts and board games (for example, chess).

Friday, 10.30am to 1pm – Warm space, tea, coffee, biscuits and singing.

Sunday, 12.30pm to 2.30pm – Feeding for the homeless and showers.

Contact details:

Pastor Toyin Taiwo
07593 331294

Tuesdays and Wednesdays 8.30am to 4pm

A free warm space offering hot and cold drinks, food, activities and advice.

Contact details:

Rev Sally-Anne
07307 201718

Lisa Blakemore
07805 084376

Jacob Glaister
07310 715213

Tuesday and Wednesday evening's 6pm to 8pm.

Warm space, free hot drinks, biscuits, snacks and table games.

Contact details:

Ian Macleod
07368 331219

Tuesdays and Fridays between 12.30pm and 5pm

A free warm space offering drinks.

Other services include a book and DVD library, activities such as crafts etc, social interaction, and advice and support.

Contact details:

Tony Hedley
07547 757670
tonyhedley@gmail.com

Starting 2 November - Wednesday 10am to 12.30pm

A free warm space called ‘Welcome Wednesdays’ offering hot drinks, toast, biscuits.

There are also activities such as card making, and knitting.

We can offer a quiet space to read.

Toys will be available for babies / toddlers.

There will also be give-aways such as knitted gloves and hats.

Contact details:

Rev Tracey Harris
tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk
01246 274481

Tuesdays between 10am and 1pm

A free warm space offering hot drinks, biscuits and soup.

There are also activities such as games and cards, and toys / books are available for children.

We also offer a quiet space for anyone who may want to talk if they are feeling anxious, worried, on a one-to-one basis.

We have a trained Mental Health First Aider available.

Contact details:

Gill Carlile
2duckies@googlemail.com
07521 353467

Wednesday to Saturday, 10am to 4pm

The Community Hub provides friendship and purpose. It is open to all, with ‘pay-it-forward’ free drinks, food or affordable refreshments to buy.

There is also wifi available, a book swap, lots of activities and clubs.

People are welcome to stay all day.

Contact details:

Valerie Wilkinson and Simon Redding

info@MonkeyPark.org.uk

St Thomas’ welcomes people to attend the centre to get warm whilst its activities are running. It's free to enter and you don’t have to be involved in any of the activities (although if you do and you’re struggling financially, there will be no charge for the activities).

Tots Time: Thursdays in term time, 9.30am to 10.30am and 11am to 12pm

Tots group for babies, toddlers and pre-schoolers and their grown ups. Songs, Bible stories, sensory activities. Socialising for children and adults. Hot drink and biscuit included for adults. £1 per session.

St Thomas' Kids Club: Thursdays in term time, 5.30pm to 6.30pm

Kids club for children in Reception-Year 6. Friends, games, Bible, fun. £1 per session.

Knit and Natter: Tuesdays, 9.30am to 12pm

Knit and Natter is a friendly group of people who enjoy crafts. £3.50 per session which includes refreshments.

Golden Folks: First Tuesday of the month, 1pm to 3pm

Golden Folks is an over 60’s group. There is usually a speaker or an activity. £5 per session which includes tea/coffee and cake.

Thom's Blokes: Third Tuesday of the month, 1pm

For men of all ages. For some meetings we take a trip out to a nearby place of interest. The cost of these visits depends on the admission price at the venue. Alternatively we meet at 1pm in the Church Centre to listen to a guest speaker – the cost then is £3 per person. Talks range over a wide variety of topics.

Contact details:

St Thomas, Brampton church office
01246 558461
contact@stthomasbrampton.com

Starting 8 November - Tuesdays (except for first Tuesday of each month), 9am to 12pm

A free warm space / community coffee morning with refreshments.

There are also activities such as jigsaw puzzles and board games, and toys are available for pre-school children.

We also run a book exchange.

Contact details:

Rev Tracey Harris
tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk
01246 274481

Monday to Thursday, 11am to 3pm

A free warm space offering hot drinks and biscuits.

People are welcome to join in the various activities that are accessible and inclusive, including:

- reading
- card making
- photography
- gaming
- art
- sing-a-long
- crochet
- fabric crafts
- skill swap
- tech-buddies

Refreshments are provided.

Contact details:

James Starky
07743 514934
01246 555908

James@dva,org,uk

- Hasland Community Hub

Mondays: 9.30am  to 12pm

Wednesdays: 12.30pm to 3.30pm

1st Friday of the Month (Let's Chat Project): 10am to 12pm noon

Mondays: Warm space and a cuppa. Activity in place is walking for health, but can remain in the building, during the walk

Wednesdays: Warm space and a cuppa
The Derbyshire Unemployed Workers Centre will be running in the hall (benefits advice and support completing forms)

Contact details:

Philip Arrandale
Grassland Hasmore Big Local

- Let’s Chat Project

First Friday of the month: 10am to 12pm

Residents are invited to come along and meet new people, use the internet and access support around things like benefits advice and completing online forms.

The project offers a free warm space with free laptop use, board games available and hot drinks.

Contact details:

Chris Newton 
07825183569

- Hasland Club Ltd

Warm space, free hot drinks, biscuits, snacks and table games.

Andrew Mallender
Chair Friends of Hasland Community Hub
0777 8809059
a.mallenders@tiscali.co.uk

Open until 17 February.

Monday to Friday, 5pm to 7.30pm.

The Hub café offers warmth, TV, company, tea, coffee, biscuits, fruit and board games.

There are opportunities for the whole family to access the facilities and services provided at The Hub – including play centre, soccer school, craft, multi-sport, dance, roller disco, weight management programmes and signposting to other support agencies.

Contact details:

Jayne Bacon
jaynebacon@spireitestrust.org.uk

Thursday 1am to 2.30pm

Friday 12.45pm to 3pm

Offering an activity programme throughout the week which visitors are welcome to join in (apart from toddlers’ session).

Drinks and biscuits on offer to all visitors.

Monday – no activities, but the space is open to all.
Tuesday morning – crafts
Tuesday afternoon – games and bingo
Thursday morning – toddlers’ session
Thursday afternoon – chair-based exercise
Friday afternoon – community choir

properties.address: 160 Hemper Ln, Greenhill, Sheffield S8 7FE
properties.description: It is a primarily a library but we also run a number of groups. We have spaces for people to sit, either at a table, computer or on comfortable chairs. Wifi is available and use of the computers is free. We dont usually allow people to charge devices and we do not offer any refreshments unless it is linked to one of the activities listed above.
properties.title: Friends of Greenhill Library

properties.address: 28 Totley Brook Road, Sheffield, S17 3QS
properties.description: Mondays: Aerobics, 7pm-8pm (phone to book place). Tuesdays: Singing Teapot choir, 10am-11:30am, Yoga, 1:15pm-2:45pm (phone to book place), Shine on ladies choir, 7:30pm-9pm. Wednesdays: Coffee morning 10:30am-11:30am, Midweek service, 11:30am-12pm, Pilates classes, 9:15am-11:30am (phone to book place). Thursdays: Art group 9:30am-12pm, Rock Choir 11am-1.15pm, Social club (Alternate weeks 2:30pm-4:30pm). Fridays: Sporting Chatter 10:30am-12:30pm (1st & 3rd weeks). Sundays: Morning service, 10:30am-11:30 am, followed by hot drinks.

properties.address: The Grace Food Bank, 240 Lowedges Road, Sheffield, South Yorkshire, S8 7JB
properties.description:
Referrals by phone (preferred) or email from social workers, support workers, health professionals or other organisations supporting potential clients.
The Grace Food Bank is a community group covering the Sheffield 8 postcode area: Lowedges, Norton, Batemoor, Jordanthorpe and the surrounding areas. We provide food parcels to families / individuals who find themselves in short term financial crisis.
properties.title: Grace Foodbank
